alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:34PM EST until December 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Lehigh River At Walnutport affecting Northampton and Lehigh Counties. For the Lehigh River...including Walnutport...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lehigh River at Walnutport. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flooding begins downstream at Catasaqua and Hokendaqua. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM EST Monday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Lehigh River Walnutport 8.0 8.6 Mon 5 pm 5.4 4.6 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
